main event: A reported UFO sighting was observed and tracked both visually and on radar in Annapolis, Maryland and Washington D.C. on 27 June 1953. The object was identified as a balloon reflecting celestial lights and was observed for 20 seconds, moving towards the east at a speed of 300-600 mph.
interesting points: The sighting was observed by both military and civilian sources in Annapolis, Maryland and Washington D.C.
The object was observed for 20 seconds and was tracked on radar, moving towards the east at high speeds.
The conclusion of the investigation identified the object as a balloon reflecting celestial lights and moving at a speed consistent with typical balloon behavior.
There were no photographs or physical evidence of the reported UFO sighting.
The witness statements described the object as a bright light, initially appearing to be a plane before displaying unusual behavior such as swinging back and forth before disappearing from sight.
sighted object: one bright light moving rapidly towards the east
